author: M
title: ‘Young Gully’ To Launch New Album ‘Bermuda’
text:
October 23, 2015 | 0 Comments 
Rising hip hop artist ‘Young Gully’ will launch his new album entitled ‘Bermuda’ at The Chewstick Culture Hub onFront Street, this Saturday, October 24th at 9pm following a freestyle rap battle, where the winner walks away with $300 and bragging rights until the next battle. 
It’s free to enter the competition or to attend the event. No written lyrics will be allowed, entrants should be able to respond to various prompts and beats, as well as bring friends as the winner will be chosen by crowd applause. 
Following the battle a lineup of established hip hop entertainers will share their talents, deepen with the audience and demonstrate the range of the hip hop genre. Rowdy Piper, Combat and Haz the Human are on board to create an experience with deft hip hop artistry, original beats and well honed delivery that will complement Young Gully’s performance once he takes the stage. 
As a prelude to tomorrow’s excitement, the community is invited to attend a low key welcome flex for artist, Young Gully, tonight [Friday, October 23rd] at The Chewstick Culture Hub, 81 Front Street. 
The evening will feature the stylings of DJ Kidd Fresh as he takes attendees on a journey through hip hop past, present and future. Entry is free for the Friday event and $20 on Saturday, payable at the door. Space is limited so get there early. Tonight doors open at 7pm and Saturday, October 24 at 9:00pm. 
For more information call 292-2439 or email info@chewstick.org. Related Stories
